Comments_List: I gained historical, critical, and practical skills as they relate to ethnographic methods. I learned how to think about anthropology and ethnography in the long duree and was exposed to current examples of ethical and revelatory ethnographies.
Ethnography, theoretical frameworks, history of the anthropological field in relationship to Lain America.

Strengths: 
Great syllabus! 
The three sections of the course was extremely helpful to better understand the development of the field. 
Hemispheric perspective helped understand global frameworks of ethnography 

Weaknesses: 
Sometime there was too much to discuss that we didn't get to every reading.
I wish students led the class, even for just 10 minutes, once a semester.
Yes. Professor Ramos-Zayas is one of the best professors at Yale and she truly cares about her subject and her students.
